text: The Cartwright Creek Bridge near Springfield, Kentucky is a metal truss bridge built in 1884. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1989. It is a single-span bridge built by the King Iron Bridge Company. It was deemed significant as one of few truss bridges in Washington County surviving from the late 1800s. title: Cartwright Creek Bridge
